			<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">List of Harvard University people</h1>
									<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
									<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-head">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><table class="plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-move" role="presentation">
<tr>
<td class="mbox-image">
<div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Mergefrom.svg/50px-Mergefrom.svg.png" width="50" height="20" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Mergefrom.svg/75px-Mergefrom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/Mergefrom.svg/100px-Mergefrom.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="50" data-file-height="20" /></div>
</td>
<td class="mbox-text">
<div class="mbox-text-span">It has been suggested that <i><a href="/wiki/Harvard_Medical_School#Notable_alumni" title="Harvard Medical School">Harvard Medical School#Notable alumni</a></i> be <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Merging" title="Wikipedia:Merging">merged</a> into this article. (<a href="/wiki/Talk:Harvard_Medical_School#Notable_Alumni_section" title="Talk:Harvard Medical School">Discuss</a>) <small><i>Proposed since January 2016.</i></small></div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<td class="mbox-image">
<div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png" width="50" height="39" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/75px-Question_book-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/100px-Question_book-new.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="399" /></a></div>
</td>
<td class="mbox-text">
<div class="mbox-text-span">This article <b>needs additional citations for <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability">verification</a></b>. <span class="hide-when-compact">Please help <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit">improve this article</a> by <a href="/wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_Wiki_Markup/1" title="Help:Introduction to referencing with Wiki Markup/1">adding citations to reliable sources</a>. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.</span> <small><i>(May 2014)</i></small> <small class="hide-when-compact"><i>(<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small></div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p>This is a <b>list of <a href="/wiki/Harvard_University" title="Harvard University">Harvard University</a> people</b>.</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Nobel_laureates">Nobel laureates</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Nobel laureates">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<table class="wikitable" width="80%">
<tr>
<th width="20%">Name</th>
<th width="15%">Class year</th>
<th width="*">Notability</th>
<th width="10%" class="unsortable nowrap">Reference(s)</th>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Philip_W._Anderson" class="mw-redirect" title="Philip W. Anderson">Philip W. Anderson</a> (born 1923)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1943; PhD 1949</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Physicist" title="Physicist">Physicist</a>; <a href="/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Physics" title="Nobel Prize in Physics">Nobel Prize in Physics</a> winner (1977)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1">[1]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Christian_B._Anfinsen" title="Christian B. Anfinsen">Christian B. Anfinsen</a> (1916–1995)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1943</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Biochemist" title="Biochemist">Biochemist</a>; <a href="/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Chemistry" title="Nobel Prize in Chemistry">Nobel Prize in Chemistry</a> winner (1972)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">[2]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/J._Michael_Bishop" title="J. Michael Bishop">J. Michael Bishop</a> (born 1936)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1962</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Immunology" title="Immunology">Immunology</a>; <a href="/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Physiology_or_Medicine" title="Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine">Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine</a> winner (1989)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Percy_W._Bridgman" class="mw-redirect" title="Percy W. Bridgman">Percy W. Bridgman</a> (1882–1961)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1904; A.M. 1905; PhD 1908; Professor</td>
<td class="note">Physicist; Nobel Prize in Physics winner (1946)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">[3]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Ralph_Bunche" title="Ralph Bunche">Ralph Bunche</a> (1904–1971)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">A.M. 1928; PhD 1934</td>
<td class="note">Diplomat; Nobel Peace Prize winner (1950)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">[4]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Mario_Capecchi" title="Mario Capecchi">Mario Capecchi</a> (born 1937)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1967</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Geneticist" title="Geneticist">Geneticist</a>; Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winner (2007)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Martin_Chalfie" title="Martin Chalfie">Martin Chalfie</a> (born 1947)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1969, PhD. 1979</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Chemist" title="Chemist">Chemist</a>; Nobel Prize in Chemistry winner (2008)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Donald_J._Cram" title="Donald J. Cram">Donald J. Cram</a> (1919–2001)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1947</td>
<td class="note">Chemist; Nobel Prize in Chemistry winner (1987)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Edward_Adelbert_Doisy" title="Edward Adelbert Doisy">Edward Adelbert Doisy</a> (1893–1986)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1920</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Biochemist" title="Biochemist">Biochemist</a>; Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winner (1943)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/T._S._Eliot" title="T. S. Eliot">T. S. Eliot</a> (1888–1965)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1909; A.M. 1910; PhD (not conferred) 1914</td>
<td class="note">Poet; <a href="/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize in Literature</a> winner (1948)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/John_Franklin_Enders" title="John Franklin Enders">John Franklin Enders</a> (1897–1985)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1930</td>
<td class="note">Scientist; Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winner (1954)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">[7]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Daniel_Carleton_Gajdusek" title="Daniel Carleton Gajdusek">Daniel Carleton Gajdusek</a> (1923–2008)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD. 1946</td>
<td class="note">Physician, Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winner (1976)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Walter_Gilbert" title="Walter Gilbert">Walter Gilbert</a> (born 1932)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1953; professor</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Molecular_biologist" class="mw-redirect" title="Molecular biologist">Molecular biologist</a>; Nobel Prize in Chemistry winner (1980)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Sheldon_Lee_Glashow" title="Sheldon Lee Glashow">Sheldon Lee Glashow</a> (born 1932)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1959; professor</td>
<td class="note">Physicist; Nobel Prize in Physics winner (1979)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Roy_J._Glauber" title="Roy J. Glauber">Roy J. Glauber</a> (born 1925)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1946; PhD 1949; Professor</td>
<td class="note">Physicist; Nobel Prize in Physics winner (2005)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">[10]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Harold_E._Varmus" title="Harold E. Varmus">Harold E. Varmus</a> (born 1939)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">A.M. 1962</td>
<td class="note">Scientist; Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winner (1989)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">[43]</a></sup></td>
</tr>

<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1970</td>
<td class="note">Scientist; Nobel Prize in Physics winner (2012)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">[44]</a></sup></td>
</tr>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Pulitzer_Prize_winners">Pulitzer Prize winners</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Pulitzer Prize winners">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Royalty_and_nobility">Royalty and nobility</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Royalty and nobility">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Sheikh" title="Sheikh">Sheikh</a> Dr. <a href="/wiki/Muhammad_Sabah_Al-Salem_Al-Sabah" class="mw-redirect" title="Muhammad Sabah Al-Salem Al-Sabah">Muhammad Sabah Al-Salem Al-Sabah</a> (born 1955)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD</td>
<td class="note">Son of late <a href="/wiki/Emir_of_Kuwait" class="mw-redirect" title="Emir of Kuwait">Emir of Kuwait</a>, Sheikh <a href="/wiki/Sabah_III_Al-Salim_Al-Sabah" class="mw-redirect" title="Sabah III Al-Salim Al-Sabah">Sabah III Al-Salim Al-Sabah</a>; Ambassador of <a href="/wiki/Kuwait" title="Kuwait">Kuwait</a> to the United States from 1993 to 2003; <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Kuwait" title="Politics of Kuwait">Minister of Foreign Affairs of Kuwait</a> from 2003 to 2011; current <a href="/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister" class="mw-redirect" title="Deputy Prime Minister">Deputy Prime Minister</a> of Kuwait; his elder brother is Sheikh <a href="/wiki/Salem_Sabah_Al-Salem_Al-Sabah" title="Salem Sabah Al-Salem Al-Sabah">Salem Sabah Al-Salem Al-Sabah</a>, former Defense and Interior Minister</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-news-events_84-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-news-events-84">[84]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Aga_Khan_IV" title="Aga Khan IV">Aga Khan IV</a> (born 1936)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">B.A. 1959</td>
<td class="note">Born Prince Karim Aga Khan, he is the 49th and current <a href="/wiki/Imam" title="Imam">Imam</a> of <a href="/wiki/Nizari" title="Nizari">Nizari Ismailism</a>, and a descendant of <a href="/wiki/Shah" title="Shah">Shah</a> (Emperor) <a href="/wiki/Fat%E2%80%B2h-Ali_Shah_Qajar" class="mw-redirect" title="Fat′h-Ali Shah Qajar">Fat′h-Ali Shah Qajar</a> of the Persian <a href="/wiki/Qajar_dynasty" title="Qajar dynasty">Qajar dynasty</a></td>

</tr>

<td style="text-align:center;">HKS 1968</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/List_of_monarchs_of_Nepal" class="mw-redirect" title="List of monarchs of Nepal">King of Nepal</a></td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Frederik,_Crown_Prince_of_Denmark" title="Frederik, Crown Prince of Denmark">Frederik, Crown Prince of Denmark</a> (born 1968)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Academic Exchange of one year (1992–1993)</td>
<td class="note">Member of the <a href="/wiki/House_of_Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Gl%C3%BCcksburg" class="mw-redirect" title="House of Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg">House of Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg</a>; <a href="/wiki/Crown_Prince" class="mw-redirect" title="Crown Prince">Crown Prince</a> of Denmark, therefore the <a href="/wiki/Heir_apparent" title="Heir apparent">heir apparent</a> to the <a href="/wiki/List_of_Danish_monarchs" title="List of Danish monarchs">throne of Denmark</a>; elder son of <a href="/wiki/Margrethe_II_of_Denmark" title="Margrethe II of Denmark">Queen Margrethe II</a> and <a href="/wiki/Henrik,_Prince_Consort_of_Denmark" title="Henrik, Prince Consort of Denmark">Henrik, the Prince Consort</a></td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-news-events_84-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-news-events-84">[84]</a></sup></td>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Prince_Sadruddin_Aga_Khan" title="Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan">Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan</a> (1933–2003)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">College 1954</td>
<td class="note">Son of <a href="/wiki/Aga_Khan_III" title="Aga Khan III">Aga Khan III</a>, the 48th <a href="/wiki/Imam" title="Imam">Imam</a> of <a href="/wiki/Nizari" title="Nizari">Nizari Ismailism</a>; Prince Sadruddin served as <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_High_Commissioner_for_Refugees" title="United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees">United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees</a> from 1966 to 1978.</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-news-events_84-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-news-events-84">[84]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Prince_Ali-Reza_Pahlavi" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince Ali-Reza Pahlavi">Prince Ali-Reza Pahlavi</a>, of <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a> (Persia (1966–2011)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD student at the time of his death</td>
<td class="note">Member of the <a href="/wiki/Pahlavi_dynasty" title="Pahlavi dynasty">Pahlavi Imperial Family</a> of <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a> (<a href="/wiki/Persia" class="mw-redirect" title="Persia">Persia</a>); younger son of the former <a href="/wiki/Pahlavi_dynasty" title="Pahlavi dynasty">Shah of Persia</a> (Emperor of Persia), <a href="/wiki/Mohammad_Reza_Pahlavi" title="Mohammad Reza Pahlavi">Mohammad Reza Pahlavi</a>, and his third wife Empress <a href="/wiki/Farah_Pahlavi" title="Farah Pahlavi">Farah Pahlavi</a>; second in <a href="/wiki/Order_of_succession" title="Order of succession">order of succession</a> to the Iranian throne before the <a href="/wiki/Iranian_Revolution" title="Iranian Revolution">Iranian Revolution</a></td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-news-events_84-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-news-events-84">[84]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Mahidol_Adulyadej" title="Mahidol Adulyadej">Mahidol Adulyadej, Prince of Songkla</a> (1892–1929), from <a href="/wiki/Siam" class="mw-redirect" title="Siam">Siam</a> (<a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Certificate in Public Health 1921</td>
<td class="note">Member of the <a href="/wiki/House_of_Chakri" class="mw-redirect" title="House of Chakri">House of Chakri</a>, of <a href="/wiki/Siam" class="mw-redirect" title="Siam">Siam</a> (<a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>); son of King <a href="/wiki/Chulalongkorn" title="Chulalongkorn">Chulalongkorn</a> of Siam; father of King <a href="/wiki/Ananda_Mahidol" title="Ananda Mahidol">Ananda Mahidol</a> (<a href="/wiki/Rama_(King_of_Thailand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Rama (King of Thailand)">Rama</a> VIII) and King <a href="/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a> (<a href="/wiki/Rama_(King_of_Thailand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Rama (King of Thailand)">Rama</a> IX) of <a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>, grandfather of King <a href="/wiki/Vajiralongkorn" title="Vajiralongkorn">Vajiralongkorn</a> (<a href="/wiki/Rama_(King_of_Thailand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Rama (King of Thailand)">Rama</a> X) of <a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>; regarded as the father of modern medicine and <a href="/wiki/Public_health" title="Public health">public health</a> of Thailand</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-news-events_84-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-news-events-84">[84]</a></sup></td>

<td class="note">Member of the <a href="/wiki/Pahlavi_dynasty" title="Pahlavi dynasty">Pahlavi Imperial Family</a> of <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a> (<a href="/wiki/Persia" class="mw-redirect" title="Persia">Persia</a>); <a href="/wiki/Reza_Shah" title="Reza Shah">Reza Shah Pahlavi</a>'s second son; brother of <a href="/wiki/Mohammad_Reza_Pahlavi" title="Mohammad Reza Pahlavi">Mohammad Reza Pahlavi</a>; the last <a href="/wiki/Pahlavi_dynasty" title="Pahlavi dynasty">Shah of Persia</a> (Iran) <i>de facto</i></td>

<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/William_Lobkowicz" title="William Lobkowicz">Prince William zu Lobkowicz</a> (born 1961)</td>

<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
<td class="note">Member of the <a href="/wiki/House_of_Bourbon-Parma" title="House of Bourbon-Parma">Royal and Ducal House of Bourbon-Parma</a>, as well of the <a href="/wiki/Dutch_Royal_Family" class="mw-redirect" title="Dutch Royal Family">Dutch Royal Family</a>; fourth and youngest child of <a href="/wiki/Princess_Irene_of_the_Netherlands" title="Princess Irene of the Netherlands">Princess Irene of the Netherlands</a> and <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Hugo,_Duke_of_Parma" title="Carlos Hugo, Duke of Parma">Carlos Hugo, Duke of Parma</a></td>

<td class="note">Son-in-law of former King <a href="/wiki/Michael_I_of_Romania" title="Michael I of Romania">Michael I of Romania</a>; in 1996 he married <a href="/wiki/Princess_Margarita_of_Romania" class="mw-redirect" title="Princess Margarita of Romania">Princess Margarita of Romania</a>, the king's eldest daughter and the <a href="/wiki/Crown_Prince" class="mw-redirect" title="Crown Prince">Crown Princess</a> of <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a>, also known as the "Custodian of the Romanian Crown"</td>

<h2><span id="Science,_technology,_medicine,_and_mathematics"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Science.2C_technology.2C_medicine.2C_and_mathematics">Science, technology, medicine, and mathematics</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Science, technology, medicine, and mathematics">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Fred_Brooks" title="Fred Brooks">Fred Brooks</a> (born 1931)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1956</td>
<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/Turing_Award" title="Turing Award">Turing Award</a> laureate</td>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Law_and_politics">Law and politics</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Law and politics">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Heads_of_state">Heads of state</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Heads of state">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<table class="wikitable" width="80%">
<tr>
<th width="20%">Name</th>
<th width="15%">Class year</th>

<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/John_Adams" title="John Adams">John Adams</a> (1735–1826)</td>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Supreme_Court_justices">Supreme Court justices</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Supreme Court justices">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<table class="wikitable" width="80%">
<tr>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="U.S._cabinet_secretaries">U.S. cabinet secretaries</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: U.S. cabinet secretaries">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>

<tr>

<th width="15%">Class year</th>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Spencer_Abraham" title="Spencer Abraham">Spencer Abraham</a> (born 1952)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Law 1979</td>

</tr>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Bruce_Babbitt" title="Bruce Babbitt">Bruce Babbitt</a> (born 1938)</td>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="U.S._representatives">U.S. representatives</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: U.S. representatives">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<table class="wikitable" width="80%">
<tr>
<th width="20%">Name</th>

<td class="note">Judge of the <a href="/wiki/United_States_Court_of_Appeals_for_the_First_Circuit" title="United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit">United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit</a> and Judge of the <a href="/wiki/United_States_District_Court_for_the_District_of_Rhode_Island" title="United States District Court for the District of Rhode Island">United States District Court for the District of Rhode Island</a></td>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn">Hope Root {1901-1953}</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>
<td class="note">Graduated from Harvard Law School and Yale College; on December 3, 1953 he attempted to break the <a href="/wiki/Deep_diving" title="Deep diving">deep diving</a> records of 330 feet by diving with scuba gear to 400 feet; he made it to 450 feet before perishing.</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-451" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-451">[451]</a></sup></td>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Mahidol_Adulyadej" title="Mahidol Adulyadej">Mahidol Adulyadej, Prince of Songkla</a> (1892–1929), from <a href="/wiki/Siam" class="mw-redirect" title="Siam">Siam</a> (<a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Certificate in Public Health 1921</td>
<td class="note">Member of the <a href="/wiki/House_of_Chakri" class="mw-redirect" title="House of Chakri">House of Chakri</a>, of <a href="/wiki/Siam" class="mw-redirect" title="Siam">Siam</a> (<a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>); son of King <a href="/wiki/Chulalongkorn" title="Chulalongkorn">Chulalongkorn</a> of Siam; father of King <a href="/wiki/Ananda_Mahidol" title="Ananda Mahidol">Ananda Mahidol</a> (<a href="/wiki/Rama_(King_of_Thailand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Rama (King of Thailand)">Rama</a> VIII) and King <a href="/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a> (<a href="/wiki/Rama_(King_of_Thailand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Rama (King of Thailand)">Rama</a> IX) of <a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>; regarded as the father of modern medicine and <a href="/wiki/Public_health" title="Public health">public health</a> of Thailand</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-news-events_84-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-news-events-84">[84]</a></sup></td>

<td class="note"><a href="/wiki/U.S._Army" class="mw-redirect" title="U.S. Army">U.S. Army</a> soldier killed in the <a href="/wiki/Vietnam_War" title="Vietnam War">Vietnam War</a>, <a href="/wiki/Medal_of_Honor" title="Medal of Honor">Medal of Honor</a> recipient</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-MOHrecips_477-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MOHrecips-477">[477]</a></sup></td>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Yonatan_Netanyahu" title="Yonatan Netanyahu">Yonatan "Yoni" Netanyahu</a> (1946–1970)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">attended 1967–68</td>
<td class="note">Commander of the elite <a href="/wiki/Israeli_army" class="mw-redirect" title="Israeli army">Israeli army</a> commando unit <a href="/wiki/Sayeret_Matkal" title="Sayeret Matkal">Sayeret Matkal</a>; killed in action during <a href="/wiki/Operation_Entebbe" title="Operation Entebbe">Operation Entebbe</a> in Uganda; awarded the <a href="/wiki/Medal_of_Distinguished_Service" title="Medal of Distinguished Service">Medal of Distinguished Service</a> for his conduct in the <a href="/wiki/Yom_Kippur_War" title="Yom Kippur War">Yom Kippur War</a></td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-478" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-478">[478]</a></sup></td>

<td class="note">Son of President <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Roosevelt" title="Theodore Roosevelt">Theodore Roosevelt</a>, U.S. Army general, <a href="/wiki/Medal_of_Honor" title="Medal of Honor">Medal of Honor</a> recipient, businessman, <a href="/wiki/Governor_of_Puerto_Rico" title="Governor of Puerto Rico">Governor of Puerto Rico</a>, <a href="/wiki/Governor-General_of_the_Philippines" title="Governor-General of the Philippines">Governor-General of the Philippines</a></td>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Religion">Religion</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=22" title="Edit section: Religion">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<table class="wikitable" width="80%">
<tr>
<th width="20%">Name</th>
<th width="15%">Class year</th>

<th width="10%" class="unsortable nowrap">Reference(s)</th>
</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">

<td style="text-align:center;">College 1656</td>
<td class="note">Founder of the First Parish Congregational Church of <a href="/wiki/York,_Maine" title="York, Maine">York</a>, the oldest church congregation in the state of Maine; killed in the <a href="/wiki/Candlemas_Massacre" class="mw-redirect" title="Candlemas Massacre">Candlemas Massacre</a></td>

<td style="text-align:center;">College 1958</td>
<td class="note">Spiritual leader of <a href="/wiki/Shia" class="mw-redirect" title="Shia">Shia</a> <a href="/wiki/Ismaili" class="mw-redirect" title="Ismaili">Ismaili</a> branch of <a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">Islam</a></td>

<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">

<td style="text-align:center;">College 1657 (Theology Degree)</td>
<td class="note">Participant in the <a href="/wiki/Salem_witch_trials" title="Salem witch trials">Salem witch trials</a> who would later apologize for his role. First minister of the parish church in <a href="/wiki/Beverly,_Massachusetts" title="Beverly, Massachusetts">Beverly, Massachusetts</a>.</td>
<td style="text-align:center;"><sup id="cite_ref-526" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-526">[526]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-527" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-527">[527]</a></sup></td>

<td class="note">Chief rabbi at <a href="/wiki/Yeshivat_Har_Etzion" title="Yeshivat Har Etzion">Yeshivat Har Etzion</a> in the West Bank; son-in-law and disciple of Rabbi <a href="/wiki/Joseph_B._Soloveitchik" title="Joseph B. Soloveitchik">Joseph B. Soloveitchik</a></td>

</tr>
</table>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Professors_and_scholars">Professors and scholars</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=27" title="Edit section: Professors and scholars">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<table class="wikitable" width="80%">
<tr>
<th width="20%">Name</th>

</tr>
<tr style="vertical-align:top;" class="vcard">
<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Eugene_C._Barker" title="Eugene C. Barker">Eugene C. Barker</a> (1874–1956)</td>
<td style="text-align:center;">Graduate study in history</td>
<td class="note">Premier historian of <a href="/wiki/Texas" title="Texas">Texas</a></td>
<td style="text-align:center;"></td>

<td class="fn"><a href="/wiki/Sylvan_Barnet" title="Sylvan Barnet">Sylvan Barnet</a></td>
<td style="text-align:center;">PhD 1954</td>
<td class="note">Shakespearean scholar</td>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Faculty">Faculty</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=List_of_Harvard_University_people&amp;action=edit&amp;section=28" title="Edit section: Faculty">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Professors who are also Harvard alumni are listed in <i>italics</i>.</p>

<li id="cite_note-NemniNemni2013-232"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-NemniNemni2013_232-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation book">Max Nemni; Monique Nemni (2013). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=PDmFP7WD8igC&amp;pg=PA11"><i>Trudeau Transformed: The Shaping of a Statesman 1944–1965</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-330"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-330">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20071007115439/http://www.oldstatehouse.com/exhibits/virtual/governors/the_new_south/tucker.asp">"James Guy Tucker, Jr. | Old State House Museum of Arkansas History"</a>. <li id="cite_note-518"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-518">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.chowrangi.com/gulgee-the-late-legend.html">"Gulgee – The Late Legend | Pakistan Politics &amp; Current Affairs"</a>. Chowrangi. January 1, 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">April 4,</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+Harvard+University+people&amp;rft.btitle=Gulgee+%E2%80%93+The+Late+Legend+%26%23124%3B+Pakistan+Politics+%26+Current+Affairs&amp;rft.date=2008-01-01&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.pub=Chowrangi&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.chowrangi.com%2Fgulgee-the-late-legend.html&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-tws01jangnnmmm-519"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-tws01jangnnmmm_519-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news">Johnson (April 9, 1999). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.julianhatton.net/NYT_99.html">"Julian Hattan"</a>. <i>The New York Times</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">January 1,</span> 2010</span>. <q>Vibrant, playful, semi-abstract landscapes. Mr. Hatton, who lives in New York, layers broad, richly colored shapes of trees, rivers and hills into funky, tautly frontal arcadian visions. His paintings seem a mix of Fauvism, Abstract Expressionism and outsider vision (Johnson).</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+Harvard+University+people&amp;rft.atitle=Julian+Hattan&amp;rft.au=Johnson&amp;rft.date=1999-04-09&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.julianhatton.net%2FNYT_99.html&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-tws01jandws32-520"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-tws01jandws32_520-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation news">John Goodrich (April 3, 2008). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.nysun.com/arts/locating-truth-within-a-grand-illusion/74075/">"Locating Truth Within a Grand Illusion"</a>. <i>The New York Sun</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">January 1,</span> 2010</span>. <q>The abstracted landscapes in Julian Hatton's seventh show at Elizabeth Harris are less "real" in terms of factual description, but they contain their own peculiar truths, evident in keenly felt colors and designs. His 14 paintings reflect an aesthetic – often underappreciated today – seeking the veracity of rhythmic form. One could say Mr. Hatton updates Matisse's updating of Giotto, in that he looks to formal relationships, stripped of academic conventions, to make a deeper semblance.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+Harvard+University+people&amp;rft.atitle=Locating+Truth+Within+a+Grand+Illusion&amp;rft.au=John+Goodrich&amp;rft.date=2008-04-03&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nysun.com%2Farts%2Flocating-truth-within-a-grand-illusion%2F74075%2F&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
<li id="cite_note-521"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-521">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dnr.mo.gov/shpo/nps-nr/72000719.pdf">"Union Station, Kansas City, National Register of Historic Places Inventory, United States Department of the Interior"</a> <span style="font-size:85%;">(PDF)</span><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">June 30,</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+Harvard+University+people&amp;rft.btitle=Union+Station%2C+Kansas+City%2C+National+Register+of+Historic+Places+Inventory%2C+United+States+Department+of+the+Interior&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.dnr.mo.gov%2Fshpo%2Fnps-nr%2F72000719.pdf&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook" class="Z3988"><span style="display:none;">&#160;</span></span></span></li>
